intro: Kageneckia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed kageneckia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Kageneckia lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
